description: From Latin renuntiāns, present participle of renuntiāre.

adjectives.description: renunciant (comparative more renunciant, superlative most renunciant)

entries.meaning: A person who renounces something; especially, someone who renounces worldly life for spiritual reasons, or a person who renounces their citizenship. [from 18th c.]
examples: The stereotypical image of the Jain renunciant is a monk (or possibly nun) dutifully sweeping the ground gently before him with a small broom […].
